section.title: About Primary Storage
section.para: Primary storage is associated with a cluster, and it stores the disk volumes for all the VMs running on hosts in that cluster. You can add multiple primary storage servers to a cluster. At least one is required. It is typically located close to the hosts for increased performance.
&PRODUCT; is designed to work with all standards-compliant iSCSI and NFS servers that are supported by the underlying hypervisor, including, for example:

listitem.para: Network Appliances filers for NFS and iSCSI

section.para: If you intend to use only local disk for your installation, you can skip to Add Secondary Storage.
